title: ROS2 Fundamentals
description: Learn the basics of Robot Operating System 2, including nodes, topics, services, and actions.
objectives: Understand ROS2 architecture and concepts
Create and manage ROS2 nodes, topics, and services
Implement robot control using rclpy
Define robot models using URDF
Debug and troubleshoot ROS2 systems

title: Simulation
description: Master simulation environments like Gazebo and Unity for testing and developing robotic systems.
objectives: Set up and configure simulation environments
Model robot sensors and physics properties
Implement physics simulations for robotic systems
Test robot algorithms in simulated environments
Transition from simulation to real-world deployment
prerequisites: Completion of Module 1 or equivalent knowledge

title: NVIDIA Isaac
description: Work with NVIDIA's robotics platform for GPU-accelerated processing and advanced simulation.
objectives: Utilize NVIDIA Isaac Sim for advanced robotics simulation
Implement Isaac ROS for perception and navigation
Configure and use Navigation2 (Nav2) for robot navigation
Leverage NVIDIA's GPU-accelerated robotics tools
Integrate perception systems for autonomous robot operation
prerequisites: Completion of Modules 1-2 or equivalent knowledge
Access to NVIDIA GPU with CUDA support

title: Vision-Language-Action Systems
description: Integrate perception, cognition, and action in unified systems using large language models.
objectives: Design and implement vision-language-action systems
Integrate large language models (LLMs) with robotic systems
Process audio input using Whisper for voice commands
Create embodied AI systems that perceive, reason, and act
Implement end-to-end learning for robot manipulation
prerequisites: Completion of Modules 1-3 or equivalent knowledge
Basic understanding of machine learning concepts
